item.title: La Gazette, mon petit canard : Concours
item.description: Concours de la Gazette de Montpellier Le jeu-concours : racontez-nous, sur le theÌ€me â€œLa Gazette, mon petit canardâ€, une histoire ou anecdote que vous inspire La Gazette : texte (court), poeÌ€me, chanson, videÌo, rap, histoire droÌ‚le, tableau, sculptureâ€¦ Laissez parler votre creÌativiteÌ. Les creÌations les plus originales, amusantes, pertinentes, eÌmouvantes, acides, deÌlirantes,â€¦ gagneront lâ€™un des 35 lots. Surprenez-nous ! Envoyez votre production (texte, videÌo, photo, etc.) par mail Ã jb.

item.title: AmstRday's tweets
item.description: These lines of code have been lying around in a file for more than 2 months. I wrote them after SatRdays Amsterdam in September. Packages installation library(tidyverse) library(rtweet) library(knitr) library(kableExtra) library(ggiraph) library(magick) library(tidytext) library(wordcloud) library(widyr) library(igraph) library(ggraph) library(ggmap) library(maps) library(plotly) Scraping the tweets # rt_AmsteRday <- search_tweets( # "#AmsteRday", n = 2, include_rts = FALSE # ) # rt <- rt_AmsteRday # # vect <- c("#AmstRday", "#satRday", "#satRdays", "#satRdayAMS", "#satRdaysAMS") # # for( vec in vect){ # # rt_vec <- search_tweets( # vec, n = 18000, include_rts = FALSE # ) # rt <- bind_rows(rt, rt_vec) # } # # # rt <- rt %>% # unique() # # saveRDS(rt, "conttweets.

item.title: Playing with dplyr5000 - Part 1
item.description: dplyr5000 is a data package with the 5000 first travis builds of dplyr. I would like to make a beautiful barplot with these data, inspired by this tweet from Mara Averick. ğŸ“· Further adventures in ggplot2 x-axis image labelsâ€¦ "Images as x-axis labels (updated)" âœï¸ @carroll_jono "photo alignment with graph in r" (SO answer) @ClausWilkehttps://t.co/p8Tvs4sghn #rstats #dataviz /* â›¹ï¸ğŸ“Š atrocities mine, obvs */ pic.twitter.com/Wew5Wo9q4f — Mara Averick (@dataandme) October 11, 2018 Packages gh allows to get data from github.

item.title: Making an animated ggplot
item.description: I decide to talk about how I make my awesome blog banner in this first post. ğŸ˜„ Why this banner ? It’s a french wordplay with my family name Sauder => Saut d’R (R jump in english). That’s why I decided to make a banner with the R-logo jumping on some (so cool) stickers. I choose stickers of packages that I use to do this animated ggplot. Which packages ? library(tidyverse) # install.
